value.description: The value for the EJB remote channel creation option

type.description: The type of the channel creation option

path.description: The directory to store persistent timer information in

thread-pool-name.description: The name of the thread pool used to run timer service invocations

relative-to.description: The relative path that is used to resolve the timer data store location

*.description: A thread pool executor with an unbounded queue.  Such a thread pool has a core size and a queue with no upper bound.  When a task is submitted, if the number of running threads is less than the core size, a new thread is created.  Otherwise, the task is placed in queue.  If too many tasks are allowed to be submitted to this type of executor, an out of memory condition may occur.

active-count.description: The approximate number of threads that are actively executing tasks.

current-thread-count.description: The current number of threads in the pool.

task-count.description: The approximate total number of tasks that have ever been scheduled for execution.

largest-thread-count.description: The largest number of threads that have ever simultaneously been in the pool.

keepalive-time.description: Used to specify the amount of time that pool threads should be kept running when idle; if not specified, threads will run until the executor is shut down.

thread-factory.description: Specifies the name of a specific thread factory to use to create worker threads. If not defined an appropriate default thread factory will be used.

completed-task-count.description: The approximate total number of tasks that have completed execution.

name.description: The name of the thread pool.

rejected-count.description: The number of tasks that have been rejected.

*.description: A file system based passivation store

idle-timeout.description: The timeout in units specified by idle-timeout-unit, after which a bean will passivate

max-size.description: The maximum number of beans this cache should store before forcing old beans to passivate

strict-max-bean-instance-pool.description: A bean instance pool with a strict upper limit

*.description: A bean instance pool with a strict upper limit

max-pool-size.description: The maximum number of bean instances that the pool can hold at a given point in time

timeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for a bean instance to be available from the pool

aliases.description: The aliases by which this cache may also be referenced

passivation-store.description: The passivation store used by this cache

*.description: A clustered passivation store

idle-timeout.description: The timeout in units specified by idle-timeout-unit, after which a bean will passivate

cache-container.description: The name of the cache container used for the bean and client-mappings caches

client-mappings-cache.description: The name of the cache used to store client-mappings of the EJB remoting connector's socket-bindings

bean-cache.description: The name of the cache used to store bean instances.

passivate-events-on-replicate.description: Indicates whether replication should trigger passivation events on the bean

max-size.description: The maximum number of beans this cache should store before forcing old beans to passivate

transactions.description: The configuration of the transaction subsystem.

jdbc-communication-store-drop-table.description: Configure if jdbc communication store should drop tables. Default is false. The server should be restarted for this setting to take effect.

relative-to.description: References a global path configuration in the domain model, defaulting to the JBoss Application Server data directory (jboss.server.data.dir). The value of the "path" attribute will treated as relative to this path. Use an empty string to disable the default behavior and force the value of the "path" attribute to be treated as an absolute path.

deprecated.reason: Will be removed as this setting has no meaningful effect on the behavior of the transaction manager.

process-id-uuid.description: Indicates whether the transaction manager should use a UUID based process id.

number-of-nested-transactions.description: The total number of nested (sub) transactions created.

socket-binding.description: Used to reference the correct socket binding to use for the recovery environment.

number-of-timed-out-transactions.description: The number of transactions that have rolled back due to timeout.

jts.description: If true this enables the Java Transaction Service. NOTE: use of JTS requires configuration of the JacORB subsystem.

number-of-transactions.description: The total number of transactions (top-level and nested) created

object-store-path.description: Denotes a relative or absolute filesystem path denoting where the transaction manager object store should store data. By default the value is treated as relative to the path denoted by the "relative-to" attribute.

path.description: Denotes a relative or absolute filesystem path denoting where the transaction manager core should store data. By default the value is treated as relative to the path denoted by the "relative-to" attribute.

deprecated.reason: Will be removed as this setting has no meaningful effect on the behavior of the transaction manager.

jdbc-action-store-drop-table.description: Configure if jdbc action store should drop tables. Default is false. The server should be restarted for this setting to take effect.

number-of-heuristics.description: The number of transactions which have terminated with heuristic outcomes.

process-id-socket-binding.description: The name of the socket binding configuration to use if the transaction manager should use a socket-based process id. Will be 'undefined' if 'process-id-uuid' is 'true'; otherwise must be set.

use-jdbc-store.description: Use the jdbc store for writing transaction logs. Set to true to enable and to false to use the default log store type. The default log store is normally one file system file per transaction log. The server should be restarted for this setting to take effect. It's alternative to Horneq based store

number-of-aborted-transactions.description: The number of aborted (i.e. rolledback) transactions.

jdbc-state-store-table-prefix.description: Optional prefix for table used to write transcation logs in configured jdbc state store. The server should be restarted for this setting to take effect.

process-id-socket-max-ports.description: The maximum number of ports to search for an open port if the transaction manager should use a socket-based process id. If the port specified by the socket binding referenced in 'process-id-socket-binding' is occupied, the next higher port will be tried until an open port is found or the number of ports specified by this attribute have been tried. Will be 'undefined' if 'process-id-uuid' is 'true'.

jdbc-action-store-table-prefix.description: Optional prefix for table used to write transcation logs in configured jdbc action store. The server should be restarted for this setting to take effect.

use-hornetq-store.description: Use the HornetQ journal store for writing transaction logs. Set to true to enable and to false to use the default log store type. The default log store is normally one file system file per transaction log. The server should be restarted for this setting to take effect. It's alternative to jdbc based store.

hornetq-store-enable-async-io.description: Whether AsyncIO should be enabled for the HornetQ journal store. Default is false. The server should be restarted for this setting to take effect.

jdbc-state-store-drop-table.description: Configure if jdbc state store should drop tables. Default is false. The server should be restarted for this setting to take effect.

number-of-inflight-transactions.description: The number of transactions that have begun but not yet terminated.

recovery-listener.description: Used to specify if the recovery system should listen on a network socket or not.

jdbc-store-datasource.description: Jndi name of non-XA datasource used. Datasource sghould be define in datasources subsystem. The server should be restarted for this setting to take effect.

status-socket-binding.description: Used to reference the correct socket binding to use for the transaction status manager.

jdbc-communication-store-table-prefix.description: Optional prefix for table used to write transcation logs in configured jdbc communication store. The server should be restarted for this setting to take effect.

number-of-application-rollbacks.description: The number of transactions that have been rolled back by application request. This includes those that timeout, since the timeout behavior is considered an attribute of the application configuration.

node-identifier.description: Used to set the node identifier on the core environment.

enable-tsm-status.description: Whether the transaction status manager (TSM) service, needed for out of process recovery, should be provided or not..

object-store-relative-to.description: References a global path configuration in the domain model, defaulting to the JBoss Application Server data directory (jboss.server.data.dir). The value of the "path" attribute will treated as relative to this path. Use an empty string to disable the default behavior and force the value of the "path" attribute to be treated as an absolute path.

number-of-resource-rollbacks.description: The number of transactions that rolled back due to resource (participant) failure.

log-store.description: Representation of the transaction logging storage mechanism.
Representation of the transaction logging storage mechanism.

type.description: Specifies the implementation type of the logging store.

transactions.description: The persistent information that the transaction manager stores for the purpose of recovering a transaction in the event of failure. The probe operation will add and remove transactions from the model as the corresponding real transactions start and finish the prepare and commit phases. A stuck transaction will remain in the model until either it is completed or explicitly removed by the delete operation.

*.description: The persistent information that the transaction manager stores for the purpose of recovering a transaction in the event of failure. The probe operation will add and remove transactions from the model as the corresponding real transactions start and finish the prepare and commit phases. A stuck transaction will remain in the model until either it is completed or explicitly removed by the delete operation.

jmx-name.description: The JMX name of this transaction.

type.description: The type name under which this record is stored.

age-in-seconds.description: The time since this transaction was prepared or when the recovery system last tried to recover it.

participants.description: The resources that did work in a transaction.

*.description: The resources that did work in a transaction.

jmx-name.description: The JMX name of this participant.

eis-product-name.description: The JCA enterprise information system's product name.

status.description: Reports the commitment status of this participant (can be one of Pending, Prepared, Failed, Heuristic or Readonly).

eis-product-version.description: The JCA enterprise information system's product version

type.description: The type name under which this record is stored.

commit-markable-resource.description: a CMR resource (i.e. a local resource that can reliably participate in an XA transaction)

batch-size.description: Batch size for this CMR resource

immediate-cleanup.description: Immediate cleanup associated to this CMR resource

name.description: table name for storing XIDs

deployment-name.description: The name of the deployment unit from which the driver was loaded

driver-module-name.description: The name of the module from which the driver was loaded, if it was loaded from the module path

module-slot.description: The slot of the module from which the driver was loaded, if it was loaded from the module path

jdbc-compliant.description: Whether or not the driver is JDBC compliant

share-prepared-statements.description: Whether to share prepared statements, i.e. whether asking for same statement twice without closing uses the same underlying prepared statement

driver-class.description: The fully qualified name of the JDBC driver class

prepared-statements-cache-size.description: The number of prepared statements per connection in an LRU cache

password.description: Specifies the password used when creating a new connection

max-pool-size.description: The max-pool-size element specifies the maximum number of connections for a pool. No more connections will be created in each sub-pool

set-tx-query-timeout.description: Whether to set the query timeout based on the time remaining until transaction timeout. Any configured query timeout will be used if there is no transaction

jndi-name.description: Specifies the JNDI name for the datasource

url-delimiter.description: Specifies the delimiter for URLs in connection-url for HA datasources

enabled.description: Specifies if the datasource should be enabled

connectable.description: Enable the use of CMR. This feature means that a local resource can reliably participate in an XA transaction.

blocking-timeout-wait-millis.description: The blocking-timeout-millis element specifies the maximum time, in milliseconds, to block while waiting for a connection before throwing an exception. Note that this blocks only while waiting for locking a connection, and will never throw an exception if creating a new connection takes an inordinately long time

statistics-enabled.description: define if runtime statistics is enabled or not

pool-use-strict-min.description: Specifies if the min-pool-size should be considered strictly

validate-on-match.description: The validate-on-match element specifies if connection validation should be done when a connection factory attempts to match a managed connection. This is typically exclusive to the use of background validation

transaction-isolation.description: Set the java.sql.Connection transaction isolation level. Valid values are: TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED, TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED, TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ, TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE and TRANSACTION_NONE

valid-connection-checker-class-name.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ValidConnectionChecker that provides an isValidConnection(Connection) method to validate a connection. If an exception is returned that means the connection is invalid. This overrides the check-valid-connection-sql element

allocation-retry-wait-millis.description: The allocation retry wait millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait between retrying to allocate a connection

background-validation-millis.description: The background-validation-millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource,  requires a server restart otherwise

track-statements.description: Whether to check for unclosed statements when a connection is returned to the pool, result sets are closed, a statement is closed or return to the prepared statement cache. Valid values are: "false" - do not track statements, "true" - track statements and result sets and warn when they are not closed, "nowarn" - track statements but do not warn about them being unclosed

use-fast-fail.description: Whether to fail a connection allocation on the first try if it is invalid (true) or keep trying until the pool is exhausted of all potential connections (false)

flush-strategy.description: Specifies how the pool should be flush in case of an error. Valid values are: FailingConnectionOnly (default), IdleConnections and EntirePool

stale-connection-checker-class-name.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionChecker that provides an isStaleConnection(SQLException) method which if it returns true will wrap the exception in an org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionException

exception-sorter-class-name.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ExceptionSorter that provides an isExceptionFatal(SQLException) method to validate if an exception should broadcast an error

background-validation.description: An element to specify that connections should be validated on a background thread versus being validated prior to use. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource,  requires a server restart otherwise.

check-valid-connection-sql.description: Specify an SQL statement to check validity of a pool connection. This may be called when managed connection is obtained from the pool

reauth-plugin-class-name.description: The fully qualified class name of the reauthentication plugin implementation

allow-multiple-users.description: Specifies if multiple users will access the datasource through the getConnection(user, password) method and hence if the internal pool type should account for that

user-name.description: Specify the user name used when creating a new connection

use-ccm.description: Enable the use of a cached connection manager

reauth-plugin-properties.description: The properties for the reauthentication plugin

datasource-class.description: The fully qualified name of the JDBC datasource class

idle-timeout-minutes.description: The idle-timeout-minutes elements specifies the maximum time, in minutes, a connection may be idle before being closed. The actual maximum time depends also on the IdleRemover scan time, which is half of the smallest idle-timeout-minutes value of any pool. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource, requires a server restart otherwise.

query-timeout.description: Any configured query timeout in seconds. If not provided no timeout will be set

use-java-context.description: Setting this to false will bind the datasource into global JNDI

min-pool-size.description: The min-pool-size element specifies the minimum number of connections for a pool

allocation-retry.description: The allocation retry element indicates the number of times that allocating a connection should be tried before throwing an exception

security-domain.description: Specifies the security domain which defines the javax.security.auth.Subject that are used to distinguish connections in the pool

new-connection-sql.description: Specifies an SQL statement to execute whenever a connection is added to the connection pool

use-try-lock.description: Any configured timeout for internal locks on the resource adapter objects in seconds

pool-prefill.description: Should the pool be prefilled. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource, requires a server restart otherwise.

*.description: List of xa-datasource-property

value.description: Specifies a property value to assign to the XADataSource implementation class. Each property is identified by the name attribute and the property value is given by the xa-datasource-property element content. The property is mapped onto the XADataSource implementation by looking for a JavaBeans style getter method for the property name. If found, the value of the property is set using the JavaBeans setter with the element text translated to the true property type using the java.beans.PropertyEditor

deployment-scanner.description: An individual deployment scanner that scans a particular location

scanner.description: The scanners maintained by the subsystem.

*.description: The configuration of the deployment scanner subsystem

relative-to.description: Reference to a filesystem path defined in the "paths" section of the server configuration.

path.description: The actual filesystem path to be scanned. Treated as an absolute path, unless the 'relative-to' attribute is specified, in which case the value is treated as relative to that path.

auto-deploy-exploded.description: Allows the automatic deployment of exploded content without requiring a .dodeploy marker file. Recommended for only basic development scenarios to prevent exploded application deployment from occuring during changes by the developer or operating system.

auto-deploy-xml.description: Allows automatic deployment of XML content without requiring a .dodeploy marker file.

scan-enabled.description: Flag indicating that all scanning (including initial scanning at startup) should be disabled.

scan-interval.description: Periodic interval, in milliseconds, at which the repository should be scanned for changes. A value of less than 1 indicates the repository should only be scanned at initial startup.

auto-deploy-zipped.description: Allows automatic deployment of zipped content without requiring a .dodeploy marker file.

deployment-timeout.description: The time value in seconds for the deployment scanner to allow a deployment attempt before being cancelled.

logging.description: The configuration of the logging subsystem.

add-logging-api-dependencies.description: Indicates whether or not logging API dependencies should be added to deployments during the deployment process. A value of true will add the dependencies to the deployment. A value of false will skip the deployment from being processed for logging API dependencies.

pattern-formatter.description: A pattern formatter to be used with handlers.

*.description: A pattern formatter to be used with handlers.

pattern.description: Defines a pattern for the formatter.

color-map.description: The color-map attribute allows for a comma delimited list of colors to be used for different levels with a pattern formatter. The format for the color mapping pattern is level-name:color-name.Valid Levels; severe, fatal, error, warn, warning, info, debug, trace, config, fine, finer, finest Valid Colors; black, green, red, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, white, brightblack, brightred, brightgreen, brightblue, brightyellow, brightmagenta, brightcyan, brightwhite

size-rotating-file-handler.description: Defines a handler which writes to a file, rotating the log after a the size of the file grows beyond a certain point and keeping a fixed number of backups.

*.description: A logging handler.

enabled.description: If set to true the handler is enabled and functioning as normal, if set to false the handler is ignored when processing log messages.

append.description: Specify whether to append to the target file.

rotate-size.description: The size at which to rotate the log file.

rotate-on-boot.description: Indicates the file should be rotated each time the file attribute is changed. This always happens when at initialization time.

named-formatter.description: The name of the defined formatter to be used on the handler.

formatter.description: Defines a pattern for the formatter.

filter-spec.description: A filter expression value to define a filter. Example for a filter that does not match a pattern: not(match("JBAS.*"))

level.description: The log level specifying which message levels will be logged by this logger. Message levels lower than this value will be discarded.

max-backup-index.description: The maximum number of backups to keep.

file.description: The file description consisting of the path and optional relative to path.

relative-to.description:
The name of another previously named path, or of one of the standard paths provided by the system. If 'relative-to' is provided, the value of the 'path' attribute is treated as relative to the path specified by this attribute. The standard paths provided by the system include:
  • jboss.home - the root directory of the JBoss AS distribution
  • user.home - user's home directory
  • user.dir - user's current working directory
  • java.home - java installation directory
  • jboss.server.base.dir - root directory for an individual server instance
  • jboss.server.data.dir - directory the server will use for persistent data file storage
  • jboss.server.log.dir - directory the server will use for log file storage
  • jboss.server.tmp.dir - directory the server will use for temporary file storage
  • jboss.domain.servers.dir - directory under which a host controller will create the working area for individual server instances

file.description: The file description consisting of the path and optional relative to path.

relative-to.description:
The name of another previously named path, or of one of the standard paths provided by the system. If 'relative-to' is provided, the value of the 'path' attribute is treated as relative to the path specified by this attribute. The standard paths provided by the system include:
  • jboss.home - the root directory of the JBoss AS distribution
  • user.home - user's home directory
  • user.dir - user's current working directory
  • java.home - java installation directory
  • jboss.server.base.dir - root directory for an individual server instance
  • jboss.server.data.dir - directory the server will use for persistent data file storage
  • jboss.server.log.dir - directory the server will use for log file storage
  • jboss.server.tmp.dir - directory the server will use for temporary file storage
  • jboss.domain.servers.dir - directory under which a host controller will create the working area for individual server instances

*.description: Defines a syslog handler.

port.description: The port the syslog server is listening on.

app-name.description: The app name used when formatting the message in RFC5424 format. By default the app name is "java".

enabled.description: If set to true the handler is enabled and functioning as normal, if set to false the handler is ignored when processing log messages.

level.description: The log level specifying which message levels will be logged by this logger. Message levels lower than this value will be discarded.

facility.description: Facility as defined by RFC-5424 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5424)and RFC-3164 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3164).

server-address.description: The address of the syslog server.

hostname.description: The name of the host the messages are being sent from. For example the name of the host the application server is running on.

syslog-format.description: Formats the log message according to the RFC specification.

pojo.description: Support JBoss5 and JBoss6 pojo configuration model.

jpa.description: The configuration of the JPA subsystem.

default-extended-persistence-inheritance.description: Controls how JPA extended persistence context (XPC) inheritance is performed. 'DEEP' shares the extended persistence context at top bean level.  'SHALLOW' the extended persistece context is only shared with the parent bean (never with sibling beans).

default-datasource.description: The name of the default global datasource.

naming.description: The configuration of the naming subsystem.

*.description: JNDI bindings for primitive types

module.description: The module to load the object factory from for object factory bindings

environment.description: The environment to use on object factory instance retrieval

binding-type.description: The type of binding to create, may be simple, lookup, external-context or object-factory

cache.description: If the external context should be cached

value.description: The value to bind for simple bindings

class.description: The object factory class name for object factory bindings

type.description: The type of the value to bind for simple bindings, this must be a primitive type

lookup.description: The entry to lookup in JNDI for lookup bindings

ee.description: The configuration of the EE subsystem.

annotation-property-replacement.description: Flag indicating whether EJB annotations will have property replacements applied

spec-descriptor-property-replacement.description: Flag indicating whether descriptors defined by the Java EE specification will have property replacements applied

jboss-descriptor-property-replacement.description: Flag indicating whether JBoss specific deployment descriptors will have property replacements applied

global-modules.description: A list of modules that should be made available to all deployments.

name.description: The name of the module

annotations.description: If a pre-computed annotation index should be imported from META-INF/jandex.idx

services.description: If any services exposed in META-INF/services should be made available to the deployments class loader

meta-inf.description: If a modules META-INF directory should be made available to the deployments class loader

ear-subdeployments-isolated.description: Flag indicating whether each of the subdeployments within a .ear can access classes belonging to another subdeployment within the same .ear. A value of false means the subdeployments can see classes belonging to other subdeployments within the .ear.

proxy-name.description: The host name that will be used when sending a redirect. The default value is null.

enabled.description: Defines whether the connector should be started on startup.

enable-lookups.description: Enable DNS lookups for Servlet API.

executor.description: The name of the executor that should be used for the processing threads of this connector. If undefined defaults to using an internal pool.

processingTime.description: Processing time used by the connector. Im milli-seconds.

proxy-binding.description: The socket binding to define the host and port that will be used when sending a redirect. The default value is null.

redirect-port.description: The port for redirection to a secure connector.

bytesReceived.description: Number of byte received by the connector (POST data).

redirect-binding.description: The socket binding to define the port for redirection to a secure connector.

max-connections.description: Amount of concurrent connections that can be processed by the connector with optimum performance. The default value depends on the connector used.

max-save-post-size.description: Maximum size in bytes of a POST request that will be saved during certain authentication schemes.

*.description: The configuration of a resource adapter.

module.description: Specifies the module from which resource adapter will be loaded

beanvalidationgroups.description: Specifies the bean validation groups that should be used.

transaction-support.description: Specifies the transaction support level of the resource adapter.

bootstrap-context.description: Specifies the unique name of the bootstrap context that should be used.

connection-definitions.description: The configuration of this resource adapter's connection definitions.

*.description: Specifies a connection definition.

pool-prefill.description: Should the pool be prefilled. Changing this value requires a server restart.

no-tx-separate-pool.description: Oracle does not like XA connections getting used both inside and outside a JTA transaction. To workaround the problem you can create separate sub-pools for the different contexts.

use-fast-fail.description: Whether to fail a connection allocation on the first try if it is invalid (true) or keep trying until the pool is exhausted of all potential connections (false).

recovery-security-domain.description: The security domain used for recovery.

flush-strategy.description: Specifies how the pool should be flush in case of an error. Valid values are: FailingConnectionOnly (default), IdleConnections and EntirePool.

background-validation.description: An element to specify that connections should be validated on a background thread versus being validated prior to use. Changing this value requires a server restart.

class-name.description: Specifies the fully qualified class name of a managed connection factory or admin object.

interleaving.description: An element to enable interleaving for XA connections.

recovery-plugin-class-name.description: The fully qualified class name of the recovery plugin implementation.

use-ccm.description: Enable the use of a cached connection manager.

wrap-xa-resource.description: Should the XAResource instances be wrapped in a org.jboss.tm.XAResourceWrapper instance.

max-pool-size.description: The max-pool-size element specifies the maximum number of connections for a pool. No more connections will be created in each sub-pool.

jndi-name.description: Specifies the JNDI name for the connection factory.

enabled.description: Specifies if the resource adapter should be enabled.

recovery-plugin-properties.description: The properties for the recovery plugin.

idle-timeout-minutes.description: The idle-timeout-minutes elements specifies the maximum time, in minutes, a connection may be idle before being closed. The actual maximum time depends also on the IdleRemover scan time, which is half of the smallest idle-timeout-minutes value of any pool. Changing this value requires a server restart..

same-rm-override.description: The is-same-rm-override element allows one to unconditionally set whether the javax.transaction.xa.XAResource.isSameRM(XAResource) returns true or false.

blocking-timeout-wait-millis.description: The blocking-timeout-millis element specifies the maximum time, in milliseconds, to block while waiting for a connection before throwing an exception. Note that this blocks only while waiting for locking a connection, and will never throw an exception if creating a new connection takes an inordinately long time.

use-java-context.description: Setting this to false will bind the object into global JNDI.

pool-use-strict-min.description: Specifies if the min-pool-size should be considered strictly.

security-domain-and-application.description: Indicates that either app supplied parameters (such as from getConnection(user, pw)) or Subject (from security domain) are used to distinguish connections in the pool.

security-application.description: Indicates that app supplied parameters (such as from getConnection(user, pw)) are used to distinguish connections in the pool.

min-pool-size.description: The min-pool-size element specifies the minimum number of connections for a pool.

allocation-retry.description: The allocation retry element indicates the number of times that allocating a connection should be tried before throwing an exception.

security-domain.description: Specifies the security domain which defines the javax.security.auth.Subject that are used to distinguish connections in the pool.

xa-resource-timeout.description: The value is passed to XAResource.setTransactionTimeout(), in seconds. Default is zero.

recovery-username.description: The user name used for recovery.

no-recovery.description: Specifies if the connection pool should be excluded from recovery.

allocation-retry-wait-millis.description: The allocation retry wait millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait between retrying to allocate a connection.

use-try-lock.description: Any configured timeout for internal locks on the resource adapter objects in seconds.

background-validation-millis.description: The background-validation-millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run. Changing this value requires a server restart.

path.description: A list of named filesystem paths.

*.description: A named filesystem path.

name.description:
The name of the path. Cannot be one of the standard fixed paths provided by the system:
  • jboss.home - the root directory of the JBoss AS distribution
  • user.home - user's home directory
  • user.dir - user's current working directory
  • java.home - java installation directory
  • jboss.server.base.dir - root directory for an individual server instance
Note that the system provides other standard paths that can be overridden by declaring them in the configuration file. See the 'relative-to' attribute documentation for a complete list of standard paths.

path.description:
The actual filesystem path. Treated as an absolute path, unless the 'relative-to' attribute is specified, in which case the value is treated as relative to that path.

If treated as an absolute path, the actual runtime pathname specified by the value of this attribute will be determined as follows:

If this value is already absolute, then the value is directly used. Otherwise the runtime pathname is resolved in a system-dependent way. On UNIX systems, a relative pathname is made absolute by resolving it against the current user directory. On Microsoft Windows systems, a relative pathname is made absolute by resolving it against the current directory of the drive named by the pathname, if any; if not, it is resolved against the current user directory.

read-only.description: True if added by the system, false if configured by user. If true, the path cannot be removed or modified.

relative-to.description:
The name of another previously named path, or of one of the standard paths provided by the system. If 'relative-to' is provided, the value of the 'path' attribute is treated as relative to the path specified by this attribute. The standard paths provided by the system include:
  • jboss.home - the root directory of the JBoss AS distribution
  • user.home - user's home directory
  • user.dir - user's current working directory
  • java.home - java installation directory
  • jboss.server.base.dir - root directory for an individual server instance
  • jboss.server.data.dir - directory the server will use for persistent data file storage
  • jboss.server.log.dir - directory the server will use for log file storage
  • jboss.server.tmp.dir - directory the server will use for temporary file storage
  • jboss.domain.servers.dir - directory under which a host controller will create the working area for individual server instances

system-property.description: A list of system properties to set on the server.

*.description: A system property to set on the server.

value.description: The value of the system property.

socket-binding-group.description: A list of socket bindings available for use on the server.

*.description: Contains a list of socket configurations.

port-offset.description: Increment to apply to the base port values defined in the socket bindings to derive the runtime values to use on this server.

default-interface.description: Name of an interface that should be used as the interface for any sockets that do not explicitly declare one.

name.description: The name of the socket binding group.

*.description: Configuration information for a socket.

port.description: Number of the port to which the socket should be bound.

bound-port.description: The port to which the actual socket using this socket binding configuration has been bound, or undefined if no socket has been bound.

interface.description: Name of the interface to which the socket should be bound, or, for multicast sockets, the interface on which it should listen. This should be one of the declared interfaces.

fixed-port.description: Whether the port value should remain fixed even if numeric offsets are applied to the other sockets in the socket group.

client-mappings.description: Specifies zero or more client mappings for this socket binding. A client connecting to this socket should use the destination address specified in the mapping that matches its desired outbound interface. This allows for advanced network topologies that use either network address translation, or have bindings on multiple network interfaces to function. Each mapping should be evaluated in declared order, with the first successful match used to determine the destination.

source-network.description: Source network the client connection binds on. This value is in the form of ip/netmask. A client should match this value against the desired client host network interface, and if matched the client should connect to the corresponding destination values. If omitted this mapping should match any interface.

destination-address.description: The destination address that a client should connect to if the source-network matches. This value can either be a hostname or an ip address.

destination-port.description: The destination port that a client should connect to if the source-network matches. If omitted this mapping will reuse the effective socket binding port.

multicast-port.description: Port on which the socket should receive multicast traffic. Must be configured if 'multicast-address' is configured.

bound-address.description: The address to which the actual socket using this socket binding configuration has been bound, or undefined if no socket has been bound.

name.description: The name of the socket. Services which need to access the socket configuration information will find it using this name.

multicast-address.description: Multicast address on which the socket should receive multicast traffic. If unspecified, the socket will not be configured to receive multicast.

bound.description: Whether an actual socket using this socket binding configuration has been bound.

remote-destination-outbound-socket-bindi.description: Configuration information for a, remote destination, outbound socket binding.

*.description: Configuration information for a remote destination outbound socket binding.

port.description: The port number of the remote destination to which the outbound socket should connect.

host.description: The host name or the IP address of the remote destination to which this outbound socket will connect.

source-interface.description: The name of the interface which will be used for the source address of the outbound socket.

source-port.description: The port number which will be used as the source port of the outbound socket.

fixed-source-port.description: Whether the port value should remain fixed even if numeric offsets are applied to the other outbound sockets in the socket group.

local-destination-outbound-socket-bindin.description: Configuration information for a, local destination, outbound socket binding.

*.description: Configuration information for a local destination outbound socket binding.

source-port.description: The port number which will be used as the source port of the outbound socket.

source-interface.description: The name of the interface which will be used for the source address of the outbound socket.

fixed-source-port.description: Whether the port value should remain fixed even if numeric offsets are applied to the other outbound sockets in the socket group.

socket-binding-ref.description: The name of the local socket-binding which will be used to determine the port to which this outbound socket connects.

management-micro-version.description: Micro version of the subsystem's management interface. May be undefined if the subsystem does not currently provide a versioned management interface.

interface.description: A list of named network interfaces available for use on the server.

*.description: Interface definition

virtual.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface is a virtual interface. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

subnet-match.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or it the address fits in the given subnet definition. Value is a network IP address and the number of bits in the address' network prefix, written in "slash notation"; e.g. "192.168.0.0/16". An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

public-address.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not it is a publicly routable address. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

point-to-point.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not its network interface is a point-to-point interface. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

nic.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface has the given name. The name of a network interface (e.g. eth0, eth1, lo). An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

loopback-address.description: Attribute indicating that the IP address for this interface should be the given value, if a loopback interface exists on the machine. A 'loopback address' may not actually be configured on the machine's loopback interface. Differs from inet-address in that the given value will be used even if no NIC can be found that has the IP specified address associated with it. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

multicast.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not its network interface supports multicast.  An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

nic-match.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface has a name that matches the given regular expression. Value is a regular expression against which the names of the network interfaces available on the machine can be matched to find an acceptable interface. An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

site-local-address.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or it is a site-local address. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

up.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface is currently up. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

any-ipv6-address.description: Attribute indicating that sockets using this interface should be bound to the IPv6 wildcard address (::).

any-address.description: Attribute indicating that sockets using this interface should be bound to a wildcard address. The IPv6 wildcard address (::) will be used unless the java.net.preferIpV4Stack system property is set to true, in which case the IPv4 wildcard address (0.0.0.0) will be used. If a socket is bound to an IPv6 anylocal address on a dual-stack machine, it can accept both IPv6 and IPv4 traffic; if it is bound to an IPv4 (IPv4-mapped) anylocal address, it can only accept IPv4 traffic.

not.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be that the IP address *does not* meet any of a nested set of criteria. The value of the attribute is a set of criteria (e.g. 'loopback') whose normal meaning is reversed. An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

inet-address.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not the address matches the given value. Value is either a IP address in IPv6 or IPv4 dotted decimal notation, or a hostname that can be resolved to an IP address. An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

link-local-address.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not the address is link-local. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

loopback.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not it is a loopback address.  An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

loopback-address.description: Attribute indicating that the IP address for this interface should be the given value, if a loopback interface exists on the machine. A 'loopback address' may not actually be configured on the machine's loopback interface. Differs from inet-address in that the given value will be used even if no NIC can be found that has the IP specified address associated with it. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

up.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface is currently up. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

virtual.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface is a virtual interface. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

loopback.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not it is a loopback address.  An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

link-local-address.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not the address is link-local. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

any.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be that the IP address meets at least one of a nested set of criteria, but not necessarily all of the nested criteria. The value of the attribute is a set of criteria. An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

inet-address.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not the address matches the given value. Value is either a IP address in IPv6 or IPv4 dotted decimal notation, or a hostname that can be resolved to an IP address. An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

link-local-address.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not the address is link-local. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

loopback.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not it is a loopback address.  An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

loopback-address.description: Attribute indicating that the IP address for this interface should be the given value, if a loopback interface exists on the machine. A 'loopback address' may not actually be configured on the machine's loopback interface. Differs from inet-address in that the given value will be used even if no NIC can be found that has the IP specified address associated with it. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

multicast.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not its network interface supports multicast.  An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

nic.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface has the given name. The name of a network interface (e.g. eth0, eth1, lo). An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

nic-match.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface has a name that matches the given regular expression. Value is a regular expression against which the names of the network interfaces available on the machine can be matched to find an acceptable interface. An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

point-to-point.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not its network interface is a point-to-point interface. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

public-address.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not it is a publicly routable address. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

site-local-address.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or it is a site-local address. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

subnet-match.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or it the address fits in the given subnet definition. Value is a network IP address and the number of bits in the address' network prefix, written in "slash notation"; e.g. "192.168.0.0/16". An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

up.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface is currently up. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

virtual.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether its network interface is a virtual interface. An 'undefined' or 'false' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection

name.description: The name of the interface.

resolved-address.description: Attribute showing the resolved ip address for this interface.

any-ipv4-address.description: Attribute indicating that sockets using this interface should be bound to the IPv4 wildcard address (0.0.0.0).

inet-address.description: Attribute indicating that part of the selection criteria for choosing an IP address for this interface should be whether or not the address matches the given value. Value is either a IP address in IPv6 or IPv4 dotted decimal notation, or a hostname that can be resolved to an IP address. An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

deployment.description: A list of deployments available for use on the server.

*.description: A deployment represents anything that can be deployed (e.g. an application such as EJB-JAR, WAR, EAR, any kind of standard archive such as RAR or JBoss-specific deployment) into a server.

runtime-name.description: Name by which the deployment should be known within a server's runtime. This would be equivalent to the file name of a deployment file, and would form the basis for such things as default Java Enterprise Edition application and module names. This would typically be the same as 'name', but in some cases users may wish to have two deployments with the same 'runtime-name' (e.g. two versions of "foo.war") both available in the deployment content repository, in which case the deployments would need to have distinct 'name' values but would have the same 'runtime-name'.

content.description: List of pieces of content that comprise the deployment.

hash.description: The hash of managed deployment content that has been uploaded to the domain's or standalone server's deployment content repository.

path.description: Path (relative or absolute) to unmanaged content that is part of the deployment.

relative-to.description: Name of a system path to which the value of the 'path' is relative. If not set, the 'path' is considered to be absolute.

archive.description: Flag indicating whether unmanaged content is a zip archive (true) or exploded (false).

enabled.description: Boolean indicating whether the deployment content is currently deployed in the runtime (or should be deployed in the runtime the next time the server starts.)

persistent.description: Boolean indicating whether the existence of the deployment should be recorded in the persistent server configuration. Only relevant to a standalone mode server. Default is 'true'. A deployment managed by a deployment scanner would have this set to 'false' to ensure the deployment is only deployed at server start if the scanner again detects the deployment.

status.description: The current runtime status of a deployment. Possible status modes are OK, FAILED, and STOPPED. FAILED indicates a dependency is missing or a service could not start. STOPPED indicates that the deployment was not enabled or was manually stopped.

name.description: Unique identifier of the deployment. Must be unique across all deployments.

subsystem.description: Runtime resources created when the deployment is deployed, organized by the subsystem responsible for the runtime resource.

web.description: Runtime resources exposed by web components in the deployment.

expired-sessions.description: Number of sessions that have expired

max-active-sessions.description: Max number of concurrent active sessions

session-max-alive-time.description: The longest time (in seconds) that an expired session had been alive

session-avg-alive-time.description: Average time (in seconds) that expired sessions had been alive

context-root.description: The context root of the web application

virtual-host.description: The name of the virtual host on which the web application is served

duplicated-session-ids.description: Number of duplicated session IDs generated by the random source (anything bigger than 0 means problems)

servlet.description: Runtime information about the servlets in the deployment.

*.description: Runtime information about the servlets in the deployment.

min-time.description: Minimum processing time of a request

processingTime.description: Total execution time of the servlet's service method

maxTime.description: Maximum processing time of a request

requestCount.description: Number of requests processed by this servlet

datasources.description: The data-sources subsystem, used to declare JDBC data-sources

*.description: A JDBC XA data-source configuration

prepared-statements-cache-size.description: The number of prepared statements per connection in an LRU cache

password.description: Specifies the password used when creating a new connection

wrap-xa-resource.description: Should the XAResource instances be wrapped in a org.jboss.tm.XAResourceWrapper instance

max-pool-size.description: The max-pool-size element specifies the maximum number of connections for a pool. No more connections will be created in each sub-pool

set-tx-query-timeout.description: Whether to set the query timeout based on the time remaining until transaction timeout. Any configured query timeout will be used if there is no transaction

jndi-name.description: Specifies the JNDI name for the datasource

url-delimiter.description: Specifies the delimiter for URLs in connection-url for HA datasources

enabled.description: Specifies if the datasource should be enabled

same-rm-override.description: The is-same-rm-override element allows one to unconditionally set whether the javax.transaction.xa.XAResource.isSameRM(XAResource) returns true or false

blocking-timeout-wait-millis.description: The blocking-timeout-millis element specifies the maximum time, in milliseconds, to block while waiting for a connection before throwing an exception. Note that this blocks only while waiting for locking a connection, and will never throw an exception if creating a new connection takes an inordinately long time

statistics-enabled.description: define if runtime statistics is enabled or not

pool-use-strict-min.description: Specifies if the min-pool-size should be considered strictly

validate-on-match.description: The validate-on-match element specifies if connection validation should be done when a connection factory attempts to match a managed connection. This is typically exclusive to the use of background validation

transaction-isolation.description: Set the java.sql.Connection transaction isolation level. Valid values are: TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED, TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED, TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ, TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE and TRANSACTION_NONE

valid-connection-checker-class-name.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ValidConnectionChecker that provides an isValidConnection(Connection) method to validate a connection. If an exception is returned that means the connection is invalid. This overrides the check-valid-connection-sql element

no-recovery.description: Specifies if the connection pool should be excluded from recovery

allocation-retry-wait-millis.description: The allocation retry wait millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait between retrying to allocate a connection

background-validation-millis.description: The background-validation-millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource,  requires a server restart otherwise

track-statements.description: Whether to check for unclosed statements when a connection is returned to the pool, result sets are closed, a statement is closed or return to the prepared statement cache. Valid values are: "false" - do not track statements, "true" - track statements and result sets and warn when they are not closed, "nowarn" - track statements but do not warn about them being unclosed

no-tx-separate-pool.description: Oracle does not like XA connections getting used both inside and outside a JTA transaction. To workaround the problem you can create separate sub-pools for the different contexts

use-fast-fail.description: Whether to fail a connection allocation on the first try if it is invalid (true) or keep trying until the pool is exhausted of all potential connections (false)

recovery-security-domain.description: The security domain used for recovery

flush-strategy.description: Specifies how the pool should be flush in case of an error. Valid values are: FailingConnectionOnly (default), IdleConnections and EntirePool

stale-connection-checker-class-name.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionChecker that provides an isStaleConnection(SQLException) method which if it returns true will wrap the exception in an org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionException

exception-sorter-class-name.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ExceptionSorter that provides an isExceptionFatal(SQLException) method to validate if an exception should broadcast an error

interleaving.description: An element to enable interleaving for XA connections

check-valid-connection-sql.description: Specify an SQL statement to check validity of a pool connection. This may be called when managed connection is obtained from the pool

reauth-plugin-class-name.description: The fully qualified class name of the reauthentication plugin implementation

allow-multiple-users.description: Specifies if multiple users will access the datasource through the getConnection(user, password) method and hence if the internal pool type should account for that

user-name.description: Specify the user name used when creating a new connection

background-validation.description: An element to specify that connections should be validated on a background thread versus being validated prior to use. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource,  requires a server restart otherwise.

use-ccm.description: Enable the use of a cached connection manager

recovery-plugin-class-name.description: The fully qualified class name of the recovery plugin implementation

reauth-plugin-properties.description: The properties for the reauthentication plugin

driver-name.description: Defines the JDBC driver the datasource should use. It is a symbolic name matching the the name of installed driver. In case the driver is deployed as jar, the name is the name of deployment unit

query-timeout.description: Any configured query timeout in seconds. If not provided no timeout will be set

idle-timeout-minutes.description: The idle-timeout-minutes elements specifies the maximum time, in minutes, a connection may be idle before being closed. The actual maximum time depends also on the IdleRemover scan time, which is half of the smallest idle-timeout-minutes value of any pool. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource, requires a server restart otherwise.

xa-datasource-class.description: The fully qualified name of the javax.sql.XADataSource implementation

recovery-plugin-properties.description: The properties for the recovery plugin

use-java-context.description: Setting this to false will bind the datasource into global JNDI

min-pool-size.description: The min-pool-size element specifies the minimum number of connections for a pool

allocation-retry.description: The allocation retry element indicates the number of times that allocating a connection should be tried before throwing an exception

security-domain.description: Specifies the security domain which defines the javax.security.auth.Subject that are used to distinguish connections in the pool

new-connection-sql.description: Specifies an SQL statement to execute whenever a connection is added to the connection pool

xa-resource-timeout.description: The value is passed to XAResource.setTransactionTimeout(), in seconds. Default is zero

recovery-username.description: The user name used for recovery

pool-prefill.description: Should the pool be prefilled. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource, requires a server restart otherwise.

use-try-lock.description: Any configured timeout for internal locks on the resource adapter objects in seconds

share-prepared-statements.description: Whether to share prepared statements, i.e. whether asking for same statement twice without closing uses the same underlying prepared statement

*.description: List of xa-datasource-property

value.description: Specifies a property value to assign to the XADataSource implementation class. Each property is identified by the name attribute and the property value is given by the xa-datasource-property element content. The property is mapped onto the XADataSource implementation by looking for a JavaBeans style getter method for the property name. If found, the value of the property is set using the JavaBeans setter with the element text translated to the true property type using the java.beans.PropertyEditor

subdeployment.description: Runtime resources associated with a child deployment packaged inside another deployment; for example a war packaged inside an ear.

*.description: A deployment represents anything that can be deployed (e.g. an application such as EJB-JAR, WAR, EAR, any kind of standard archive such as RAR or JBoss-specific deployment) into a server.

subsystem.description: Runtime resources created when the deployment is deployed, organized by the subsystem responsible for the runtime resource.

web.description: Runtime resources exposed by web components in the deployment.

expired-sessions.description: Number of sessions that have expired

max-active-sessions.description: Max number of concurrent active sessions

session-max-alive-time.description: The longest time (in seconds) that an expired session had been alive

session-avg-alive-time.description: Average time (in seconds) that expired sessions had been alive

context-root.description: The context root of the web application

virtual-host.description: The name of the virtual host on which the web application is served

duplicated-session-ids.description: Number of duplicated session IDs generated by the random source (anything bigger than 0 means problems)

servlet.description: Runtime information about the servlets in the deployment.

*.description: Runtime information about the servlets in the deployment.

min-time.description: Minimum processing time of a request

processingTime.description: Total execution time of the servlet's service method

maxTime.description: Maximum processing time of a request

requestCount.description: Number of requests processed by this servlet

datasources.description: The data-sources subsystem, used to declare JDBC data-sources

*.description: A JDBC XA data-source configuration

prepared-statements-cache-size.description: The number of prepared statements per connection in an LRU cache

password.description: Specifies the password used when creating a new connection

wrap-xa-resource.description: Should the XAResource instances be wrapped in a org.jboss.tm.XAResourceWrapper instance

max-pool-size.description: The max-pool-size element specifies the maximum number of connections for a pool. No more connections will be created in each sub-pool

set-tx-query-timeout.description: Whether to set the query timeout based on the time remaining until transaction timeout. Any configured query timeout will be used if there is no transaction

jndi-name.description: Specifies the JNDI name for the datasource

url-delimiter.description: Specifies the delimiter for URLs in connection-url for HA datasources

enabled.description: Specifies if the datasource should be enabled

same-rm-override.description: The is-same-rm-override element allows one to unconditionally set whether the javax.transaction.xa.XAResource.isSameRM(XAResource) returns true or false

blocking-timeout-wait-millis.description: The blocking-timeout-millis element specifies the maximum time, in milliseconds, to block while waiting for a connection before throwing an exception. Note that this blocks only while waiting for locking a connection, and will never throw an exception if creating a new connection takes an inordinately long time

statistics-enabled.description: define if runtime statistics is enabled or not

pool-use-strict-min.description: Specifies if the min-pool-size should be considered strictly

validate-on-match.description: The validate-on-match element specifies if connection validation should be done when a connection factory attempts to match a managed connection. This is typically exclusive to the use of background validation

transaction-isolation.description: Set the java.sql.Connection transaction isolation level. Valid values are: TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED, TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED, TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ, TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE and TRANSACTION_NONE

valid-connection-checker-class-name.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ValidConnectionChecker that provides an isValidConnection(Connection) method to validate a connection. If an exception is returned that means the connection is invalid. This overrides the check-valid-connection-sql element

no-recovery.description: Specifies if the connection pool should be excluded from recovery

allocation-retry-wait-millis.description: The allocation retry wait millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait between retrying to allocate a connection

background-validation-millis.description: The background-validation-millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource,  requires a server restart otherwise

track-statements.description: Whether to check for unclosed statements when a connection is returned to the pool, result sets are closed, a statement is closed or return to the prepared statement cache. Valid values are: "false" - do not track statements, "true" - track statements and result sets and warn when they are not closed, "nowarn" - track statements but do not warn about them being unclosed

no-tx-separate-pool.description: Oracle does not like XA connections getting used both inside and outside a JTA transaction. To workaround the problem you can create separate sub-pools for the different contexts

use-fast-fail.description: Whether to fail a connection allocation on the first try if it is invalid (true) or keep trying until the pool is exhausted of all potential connections (false)

recovery-security-domain.description: The security domain used for recovery

flush-strategy.description: Specifies how the pool should be flush in case of an error. Valid values are: FailingConnectionOnly (default), IdleConnections and EntirePool

stale-connection-checker-class-name.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionChecker that provides an isStaleConnection(SQLException) method which if it returns true will wrap the exception in an org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionException

exception-sorter-class-name.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ExceptionSorter that provides an isExceptionFatal(SQLException) method to validate if an exception should broadcast an error

interleaving.description: An element to enable interleaving for XA connections

check-valid-connection-sql.description: Specify an SQL statement to check validity of a pool connection. This may be called when managed connection is obtained from the pool

reauth-plugin-class-name.description: The fully qualified class name of the reauthentication plugin implementation

allow-multiple-users.description: Specifies if multiple users will access the datasource through the getConnection(user, password) method and hence if the internal pool type should account for that

user-name.description: Specify the user name used when creating a new connection

background-validation.description: An element to specify that connections should be validated on a background thread versus being validated prior to use. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource,  requires a server restart otherwise.

use-ccm.description: Enable the use of a cached connection manager

recovery-plugin-class-name.description: The fully qualified class name of the recovery plugin implementation

reauth-plugin-properties.description: The properties for the reauthentication plugin

driver-name.description: Defines the JDBC driver the datasource should use. It is a symbolic name matching the the name of installed driver. In case the driver is deployed as jar, the name is the name of deployment unit

query-timeout.description: Any configured query timeout in seconds. If not provided no timeout will be set

idle-timeout-minutes.description: The idle-timeout-minutes elements specifies the maximum time, in minutes, a connection may be idle before being closed. The actual maximum time depends also on the IdleRemover scan time, which is half of the smallest idle-timeout-minutes value of any pool. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource, requires a server restart otherwise.

xa-datasource-class.description: The fully qualified name of the javax.sql.XADataSource implementation

recovery-plugin-properties.description: The properties for the recovery plugin

use-java-context.description: Setting this to false will bind the datasource into global JNDI

min-pool-size.description: The min-pool-size element specifies the minimum number of connections for a pool

allocation-retry.description: The allocation retry element indicates the number of times that allocating a connection should be tried before throwing an exception

security-domain.description: Specifies the security domain which defines the javax.security.auth.Subject that are used to distinguish connections in the pool

new-connection-sql.description: Specifies an SQL statement to execute whenever a connection is added to the connection pool

xa-resource-timeout.description: The value is passed to XAResource.setTransactionTimeout(), in seconds. Default is zero

recovery-username.description: The user name used for recovery

pool-prefill.description: Should the pool be prefilled. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource, requires a server restart otherwise.

use-try-lock.description: Any configured timeout for internal locks on the resource adapter objects in seconds

share-prepared-statements.description: Whether to share prepared statements, i.e. whether asking for same statement twice without closing uses the same underlying prepared statement

*.description: List of xa-datasource-property

value.description: Specifies a property value to assign to the XADataSource implementation class. Each property is identified by the name attribute and the property value is given by the xa-datasource-property element content. The property is mapped onto the XADataSource implementation by looking for a JavaBeans style getter method for the property name. If found, the value of the property is set using the JavaBeans setter with the element text translated to the true property type using the java.beans.PropertyEditor
