webservices.description: Runtime resources exposed by web service components in the deployment.

*.description: WS endpoint

request-count.description: Count of requests the endpoint processed.

type.description: Webservice endpoint type.

fault-count.description: Count of faults the endpoint generated.

response-count.description: Count of responses the endpoint generated.

name.description: Webservice endpoint name.

jpa.description: The configuration of the JPA subsystem.

default-extended-persistence-inheritance.description: Controls how JPA extended persistence context (XPC) inheritance is performed. 'DEEP' shares the extended persistence context at top bean level.  'SHALLOW' the extended persistece context is only shared with the parent bean (never with sibling beans).

default-datasource.description: The name of the default global datasource.

*.description: Runtime information about Hibernate use in the deployment.

query-execution-max-time.description: Get the time in milliseconds of the slowest query.

query-execution-max-time-query-string.description: Get the query string for the slowest query.

query-cache-hit-count.description: Get the number of cached queries successfully retrieved from cache.

query-cache-miss-count.description: Get the number of cached queries not found in cache.

query-cache-put-count.description: Get the number of cacheable queries put in cache.

flush-count.description: Get the number of flushes executed by sessions (either implicit or explicit).

connect-count.description: Get the number of connections asked for by the sessions.

second-level-cache-hit-count.description: Number of cacheable entities/collections successfully retrieved from the cache.

second-level-cache-miss-count.description: Number of cacheable entities/collections not found in the cache and loaded.

second-level-cache-put-count.description: Number of cacheable entities/collections put in the cache.

enabled.description: Determine if statistics are enabled.

entity-cache.description: Statistics for a Hibernate Second Level Cache region.

*.description: Statistics for a Hibernate Second Level Cache region.

miss-count.description: Number of cacheable entities/collections not found in the cache and loaded.

put-count.description: Number of cacheable entities/collections put in the cache.

element-count-in-memory.description: Number of cacheable entities/collections currently stored in memory.

hit-count.description: Number of cacheable entities/collections successfully retrieved from the cache.

*.description: Statistics for individual queries.

query-execution-count.description: Get number of times query has been executed.

query-execution-max-time.description: Get the time in milliseconds of the query.

query-execution-min-time.description: Get the minimum time in milliseconds of the query.

query-execution-average-time.description: Get the average time in milliseconds of the query.

query-cache-miss-count.description: Get the number of times query was not found in cache.

query-execution-row-count.description: Get number of rows returned from executions of query.

query-cache-hit-count.description: Get the number of times query was retrieved from cache.

query-cache-put-count.description: Get the number of times query was put in cache.

time-remaining.description: The number of milliseconds that will elapse before the next scheduled timer expiration, or "undefined" if the timer has no future timeouts, is expired, or has been cancelled.

next-timeout.description: The point in time (in ms since the epoch) at which the next timer expiration is scheduled to occur, or "undefined" if the timer has no future timeouts, is expired, or has been cancelled.

calendar-timer.description: Whether this timer is a calendar-based timer, or "undefined" if the timer has expired or been cancelled.

persistent.description: Whether this timer has persistent semantics, or "undefined" if the timer has expired or been cancelled.

schedule.description: The schedule expression corresponding to this timer, or "undefined" if the timer was not created using a schedule expression, is expired, or has been cancelled.
